title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
description:
As a business analyst your primary responsibility will be to partner with key stakeholders, data engineers, and data scientists to create metrics that inform and enable our most critical strategic and operational decisions. You will help translate business needs into requirements and identify efficiency opportunities leveraging data. In addition to querying and visualizing data, you will be expected to use your expertise to provide meaningful recommendations and actionable strategies to stakeholders.
   

  

 Supply Chain Data Analyst Responsibilities:
   

  

* Partner with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions, actionable metrics and analytical frameworks
* Lead advanced data analytics projects to support business strategy, identify actionable insights and influence key business partners
* Understand business requirements and collaborate with key stakeholders to provide suggestions on best metrics and visualizations to be used
* Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and business partners to enhance and optimize our existing tools and data sources
* Intelligently design visualizations that focus on usability and ease of interpretation
* Design, build and launch reliable dashboards that provide meaningful insights across cross\-functional global teams
* Proactively identify process improvements and drive implementation to help make us a more efficient organization
* Deploy wholistic data quality checks to ensure high quality of dashboards
* Mentor, guide, lead and manage task assignments for a team of supporting contractors and other analysts to ensure project success


 Minimum Qualifications:
   

  

* BA/BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, engineering, or a related technical field
* 8\+ Years of SQL experience and relational database experience (Oracle, MySQL)
* 8\+ Years with Tableau experience
* 5\+ Years experience working in sourcing management or supporting supply chain data analytics
* Presentation and communications experience with extracting insights from technical data sets to varied audiences
* Experience navigating ambiguity in a time\-sensitive environment and prioritizing multiple work threads to maximize impact


 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

* MS in computer science, mathematics, statistics or a related field
* 10\+ years‚Äô experience of sourcing management or supply chain management with an emphasis on data center racks and equipment
* Experience with programming languages such as Python to build statistical models


 About Meta:
   

  

 Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.
   

  

 Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E\-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.
   

  

 Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations\-ext@fb.com.
   

  

 $150,000/year to $213,000/year \+ bonus \+ equity \+ benefits

title: Data Analyst
description:
The Data Analyst provides assistance with manuscript preparation and progress reports for Principal Investigators, including data analysis, reduction, and interpretation. The incumbent provides research support to departmental investigators and serve as the main point of contact for research coordinators from external collaborators. This staff member will be involved in the development of database and front\-end systems for data collection and corresponding training materials. Additionally, this position is responsible for training staff on and overseeing routine data cleaning, scoring, entry, and reporting; assisting with patient and research records management; and evaluations. The incumbent will maintain departmental standards in addition to the Institutional Review Board (IRB) and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) requirements.
   

  

* Prepare data for analytic efforts by consolidating data, reviewing quality and accuracy, cleaning, and creating final datasets for analysis.
* Prepare analytical reports by organizing, tabulating, and summarizing data for clinical operations and research projects and provide contextualized interpretations with minimal supervision.
* Create queries in the CAARE database (i.e., clinical research registry) and work with the clinical staff who manage the CAARE database activities (e.g., mailings, posting fliers, contacting outside agencies, contacting past patients) in order to assist with subject recruitment.
* Ensure overall quality of data with regular audits.
* Oversee and contribute to the development of data collection and reporting systems, including surveys, databases, front\-ends, and reports.
* Contribute to the development, maintenance, and implementation of data collection standards consistent with Institutional Review Board (IRB), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and the Center for Autism Services, Science and Innovation (CASSI) standards.
* Contribute to and oversee the development and maintenance of documentation for data systems and standards.
* Design and develop staff training materials. Provide training to new and current staff in the use of the CASSI data systems. Oversee and train data entry staff in data cleaning, scoring, and entry.
* Contribute to or undertake the development, administration, customization, maintenance, and integration of the database systems.
* Provide administrative support as needed, including inventorying, videotaping sessions, and study coordination. clean, check inventory, and replenish testing kits for of assessments and questionnaires.
* Complete general office duties to include but not limited to copying, mailing, and collating.


 EDUCATION
   

  

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, data analytics, or experimental research is required.
* Master‚Äôs degree in related field preferred.


 EXPERIENCE
   

  

* Minimum 3 years of research experience required. A Master‚Äôs degree in a related field may be substituted for up to two years of the required experience.
* Experience working with families and children preferred.


 USD $56,157\.50/Yr.
   

  

 USD $97,597\.76/Yr.

title: Staff Data Analyst
description:
**Job Title**
 Staff Data Analyst
   

  

**Requisition ID**
 R025546
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Role Within the Kingdom**
 We are seeking a passionate and skilled Staff Data Analyst to push the boundaries of mobile games analytics and advertising product performance, focusing on deep\-dive analyses and applying statistical methods to solve complex business problems
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Perform in\-depth analyses on large\-scale datasets, uncovering actionable insights that drive business performance.
* Lead the design, execution, and analysis of A/B tests and experiments, applying statistical rigor to assess performance.
* Interpret complex data using statistical methods and effectively communicate results to both technical and non\-technical stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Engineers, and Commercial leaders to develop insights that support product enhancements and business decisions.
* Build and maintain clear and concise documentation related to analyses, findings, and methodologies.
* Provide recommendations based on data\-driven insights, helping senior management and department leaders translate findings into actionable strategies.


**Minimum Qualifications**
**Skills to Create Thrills**
* 12\+ years of hands\-on experience in data analysis, focusing on Advertising, Gaming, e\-commerce, or high\-volume systems.
* Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related analytical field.
* Proficiency in complex SQL for deep\-dive analysis.
* Strong statistical skills with experience in A/B testing, hypothesis testing, regression, and other statistical methods.
* Proficiency in Python or R, primarily for statistical analysis and data manipulation.
* Proven ability to structure complex problems, conduct thorough analyses, and generate actionable insights from large datasets.
* Curious, internally motivated self\-starter with the ability to plan, organize, and establish priorities to manage multiple projects and achieve results.
* Excellent communication skills, with experience in presenting analytical findings to both technical and non\-technical audiences.


**Bonus Points**
* Demonstrated experience with experimental design, data modeling, predictive modeling, and advanced statistical techniques.
* Domain knowledge in advertising or gaming is a strong plus.
* Expertise in at least one data visualization tool (e.g., Looker, Tableau)


**Rewards**
**Requirements**
 We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well\-being for ‚ÄòEvery World‚Äô \- we‚Äôve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:
   

  

* Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD\&D insurance, disability insurance;
* 401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
* Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
* Mental health \& wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life \& disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
* If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.


 Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full\-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.
   

  

 In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $111,780\.00 \- $206,882\.00 Annual. These values reflect the expected base pay range of new hires across all U.S. locations. Ultimately, your specific range and offer will be based on several factors, including relevant experience, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share this role‚Äôs range details for your local geography during the hiring process. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed. While we strive to provide competitive offers to successful candidates, new hire compensation is negotiable.

title: Reporting & Data Analyst
description:
As an NRG employee, we encourage you to take charge of your career and development journey. We invite you to explore exciting opportunities across our businesses. You‚Äôll find that our dynamic work environment provides variety and challenge. Your growth is key to our ongoing success‚Äîtake the lead in shaping your career development, goals and future!
   

  

**Job Summary**
 NRG Home East Region is seeking an energetic and ambitious individual to support our Offer Pricing and Revenue Management team. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills with the ability to execute several different duties while maintaining the same commitment to quality and detail. This position will provide support primarily in terms of reporting, data analysis, and research but candidate should be prepared to expand their duties to meet shifting priorities within the organization.
   

  

**Essential Duties/Responsibilities**

**Why NRG Is a Great Place To Work**

 NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol\-free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post\-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. title: Population Health Quality Data Analyst
description:
As a
 **Population Health Quality Data Analyst** 
 , you will be responsible for working with team members in the evaluation of data sets on various dimensions of data quality, such as accuracy, completeness, and duplication of data. You will analyze the scope of work, requirements, tasks, resolves data quality issues, and prepares data for quality measure processing. You will work with data in a relational database environment performing extract, transform, and load (ETL) activities including pattern analysis of health care data including claims, provider, and member data. You will participate in complex data loads, queries, stored procedures and processes to maintain data integrity within the database and possesses the ability to independently move work forward.
   

  

**Essential Functions**
* You will develop, modify, execute queries for large\-scale data extraction, perform comprehensive data pre\-processing of claims, encounter, and other related healthcare data (cleansing, aggregating, sorting), and effectively combine multiple data sources for standard and ad\-hoc requests
* You will analyze complex data, synthesize analytic insights with business questions and policy knowledge
* You will coordinate research data inquiries and work with database developers for optimization
* You will work with team leads and members in planning, designing and performing data and pattern analysis of specific health care activities or projects
* You may provide consultation to team members and Program Management leadership
* You will stay abreast of database and data processing technologies
* You will create and maintain documentation to support data management activities
* You will create and manage User Stories through Jira to track tasks and projects.


**Requirements:**
* Four\-year degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, Computer Science or related field and/or equivalent training and/or experience
* Experience and/or knowledge of analyzing healthcare Medicaid and Medicare claims data
* 3\+ years in data management, analysis, and processing
* Demonstrated experience using advanced SQL
* Experience with Data Warehouse data mapping and problem solving.
* Experience and/or knowledge of claims data, Member, Enrollment, Provider, Lab, Visits, Pharmacy, etc
* Experience in data validation and quality assurance
* Experience with ETL processing
* Experience with combining data from multiple data sources
* Comfortable with customer facing role and engagement
* Ability to work with ambiguity


**Who We Are:**
 Telligen is one of the most respected population health management organizations in the country. We work with state and federal government programs, as well as employers and health plans offering clinical, analytical, and technical expertise.
   

  

 Over our 50\-year history, health care has evolved \- and so have we. What hasn't changed is our deep commitment to those we serve. Our success is built on our ability to adapt, respond to client needs and deliver innovative, mission\-driven solutions.
   

  

 Our business is our people and we‚Äôre seeking talented individuals who share our passion and are ready to take ownership, make an impact and helth shape the future of health.
   

  

**Are you Ready?**
 We‚Äôre on a mission to transform lives and economies by improving health.
   

  

**Ownership:** 
 As a 100% employee\-owned company, our employee\-owners drive our business and share in our success.
   

  

**Community:** 
 We show up \- for our clients, our communities and each other. Being a responsible corporate partner is part of who we are.
   

  

**Ingenuity:** 
 We value bold ideas and calculated risks. Innovation thrives when we challenge the status quo and listen to diverse perspectives.
   

  

**Integrity:** 
 We foster a respectful, inclusive, and collaborative environment built on trust and excellence.
   

  

**Thank you for your interest in Telligen!**
 Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn to learn more about our mission\-driven culture and stay up to speed.
   

  

*While we use artificial intelligence tools to enhance our initial screening process, all applications are thoroughly reviewed by our human recruitment team to ensure a fair and comprehensive evaluation of each candidate.*
*Telligen and our affiliates are Equal Opportunity Employers and E\-Verify Participants.*
*Telligen will not provide sponsorship for this position. If you will require sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, we cannot consider your application at this time. We will not accept 3rd party solicitations from outside staffing firms.*

title: Data Analyst
description:
**About**
**This is an in\-office position based in San Clemente, CA.**
 NEOGOV is a fast\-growing SaaS leader in the Public Sector with a mission to serve the people who serve the people. Our clients use our software to manage their employee lifecycle from hire to retire by streamlining processes in our centralized platform. We are passionate about technology, focused on customer success, and have an entrepreneurial environment where innovation is encouraged and rewarded.
   

  

 NEOGOV is one of the top 50 fastest growing private software companies in the U.S. ‚Äî Sound like a company you'd like to join? We are looking for top talent to make significant contributions to our products, technology, and customers.
   

  

 We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our revenue team. The candidate will play a key role in managing commission payout and data hygiene for the Sales and Marketing teams.
   

  

 This role will be a member of the revenue operations team, which is part of the greater sales and marketing teams here at NEOGOV.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Responsible for calculating , reviewing, and processing commission payments accurately and on schedule leveraging the Salesforce SPIFF commission platform
* Ensuring commission structures are accurately implemented and tracked
* Working with sales teams to resolve commission disputes and ensure transparency in compensation
* Work with sales leaders on commission planning and make suggestions on process and technology updates as needed
* Maintaining compliance with company policies and agreements related to commission payments
* Establish and maintain mechanisms for ensuring data quality, including monitoring data quality dashboards and conducting regular audits
* Lead efforts to clean and update data, which includes removing incorrect or duplicate entries, standardizing formats, and enriching data with missing information
* Build processes and implement tools to automate data hygiene tasks, such as data validation at the point of entry and ongoing updates to maintain data accuracy
* Work with data stewards and various departments to clarify responsibilities and build awareness around data hygiene
* Ensure that high\-quality, trustworthy data is available across various sources to enable better decision\-making, drive organizational performance, and support strategic initiatives and innovation
* Upload data to various sources as requested (EX: Use Salesforce ETL tools to insert/update/delete data)
* Collaborate with Salesforce Administrators, leveraging GTM Systems to improve data accuracy and reporting capabilities.
* Work with the revenue operations team on various analytics projects outside of commission and data hygiene, including territory development and TAM analysis


**Who You Are**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or a related field required.
* 3\+ years of experience in Sales Operations, Revenue Operations, or FP\&A, preferably supporting SaaS or high\-growth sales organizations.
* Experience with SPIFF, Salesforce, and Excel
* Experience with Sales Operations and Sales Analytics a plus
* Excellent written and verbal communication, cross\-departmental relations, and organizational skills
* Extremely detailed oriented with the ability to work independently and deliver on multiple projects, while overcoming obstacles and adhering to tight deadlines
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present process improvements and trainings as needed


**Essential Functions**
* Work in NEOGOV‚Äôs San Clemente, CA. Office
* Ability to keep up with continuous learning through self\-education
* Sit or stand for prolonged periods of time while typing/reading/listening
* Organization of work, time, and thoughts


**What NEOGOV Offers**
* Competitive Wages
* Comprehensive Benefits package (medical, dental, vision, etc.) for full\-time employees effective Day 1
* Generous PTO to support work\-life balance
* 401K Matching
* 12\-week Paid Parental Leave
* Autonomy to grow and find your career path with supportive leadership
* Remote working opportunities
* Inclusive and diverse work environment


 NEOGOV does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, protected military status, or other non\-merit factors.

title: BI Reporting Analyst
description:
**Location** 
 : Denver (local applicants only)
 



**Type** 
 : Full\-Time, Direct Hire
 



**Schedule** 
 : Onsite
 



**Salary Range:** 
 $80k \- $95k (depending on experience level)
 



  





 The BI Reporting Analyst will turn raw data into meaningful insights that drive smart business decisions. Their typical day revolves around working closely with stakeholders to understand data needs, to uncover trends, to maintain data accuracy within BI systems, and to translate business requirements into technical specs. The BI Analyst will be working with data \- connecting to various sources, cleaning and shaping the data to make it usable, and then creating compelling visualizations that tell a story.
 








**Essential Job Functions:** 



* Translate business requirements into effective BI solutions by designing data models that transform raw data into actionable insights
* Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI to support business decision\-making
* Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) aligned with organizational objectives, ensuring consistent monitoring and reporting
* Analyze complex datasets and present findings in a clear, meaningful format for stakeholders
* Convert business needs into technical specifications, including effort estimation and task timelines
* Design, develop, and deploy Power BI solutions, including advanced DAX queries and calculations for detailed analysis
* Create and document data visualizations, algorithms, parameters, and data models with clear explanations of relationships and logic
* Contribute to the design and development of data warehouses, ensuring optimized structures for reporting and analytics
* Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data efficiently
* Evaluate current ETL processes and propose improvements for scalability, reliability, and performance
* Enhance and maintain existing BI systems by implementing technical changes that improve functionality and performance








**Education and/or Experience:** 



* At least 3 years' experience working with data management and analysis applications
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, or data science related field.
* Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Power Apps, and Power Automate.
* Excellent problem\-solving, verbal and written communication, design development, and debugging skills.
* Ability to work independently using strong organizational skills and operate effectively in team settings using an agile software development approach.

**Required Skills:** 



* Experience in SQL querying and scripting languages (DAX, MDX, etc.)
* Experience with data warehousing, data lakes, and data pipelines.

* Experience working with complex datasets, including both structured and unstructured data.

* Strong problem\-solving and analytical skills to identify and solve data\-driven problems.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**About Dutchie**
 Founded in 2017, Dutchie is a comprehensive technology platform powering dispensary operations, while providing consumers with safe and easy access to cannabis. Dutchie aims to further support the positive societal change the cannabis industry brings to the world through wellness benefits, social justice, and empowering local communities through tax revenue. Powering thousands of dispensaries across 40\+ markets throughout the United States and Canada, Dutchie is the leading technology company in the cannabis space and was named in Fast Company‚Äôs 10 Most Innovative Companies in North America and listed two years in a row on LinkedIn‚Äôs Top 50 Startups.
   

  

 Dutchie has raised over $600M in funding to date, backed by D1 Capital Partners, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, DFJ Growth, Thrive Capital, Howard Schultz, Snoop Dogg‚Äôs Casa Verde Capital, Gron Ventures, members of the founding team at DoorDash, Kevin Durant‚Äôs Thirty Five Ventures, and other notable angel investors.
   

  

**About The Team...**
 Dutchie‚Äôs Data Analysts are strong strategic partners and skilled technicians. They are excellent communicators, possess strong business acumen, and are obsessed with delivering insights that drive action. They follow through on their work to ensure its usefulness to the organization, and constantly seek out feedback to make their next projects better than the last. They partner closely with technical and business teams alike and juggle multiple, complex projects at once.
   

  

 Analytics at Dutchie is centralized and segmented into 4 sub\-functions ‚Äî Go\-to\-Market, Product, CS, and Adtech support. Each analytics sub\-function aligns to key business functions and is staffed with domain experts.
   

  

 Dutchie creates products specifically tailored to the nascent cannabis industry, targeted to create safe and easy access to cannabis. Dutchie‚Äôs products create value directly to both consumers and our business customers, and the ecosystem of Dutchie‚Äôs products is lifting the entire market. In order to constantly improve our product offering, Dutchie needs insight about its products ‚Äî how they‚Äôre developed, tested, used by end customers, and how they can be improved. We need to understand how individual features help us accomplish our OKRs. We need to understand, through experimentation, what to push to production and what to rework. With this focus, the Senior Data Analyst will propel the product organization, and dutchie, forward.
   

  

**What You‚Äôll Do...**
* Execute industry\-leading approaches to measuring digital products and delivering key insights to Dutchie‚Äôs Ecommerce Product organization
* Partner with domain experts in Product and Engineering to solve problems, together
* Implement instrumentation and experimentation methods to gather insights used to optimize experiences
* Create leading\-edge analytics and insights leveraging SQL
* Create reports and dashboards that surface actionable insights for stakeholders and empower self\-service
* Collaborate with fellow analytics team members who specialize in other domain areas
* Work closely with Analytic team members and Data Engineering functions to ensure data cleanliness and availability
* Build networks through Product and adtech orgs and beyond to ensure deep connections and efficiencies through the team


**What You‚Äôll Bring...**
* 4\+ years‚Äô experience in the analytics space with a proximity to stakeholders
* 2\+ years‚Äô experience delivering insights and analytics tailored for product teams
* Experience writing complex, performant, and ultimately meaningful SQL queries
* A passion for creating meaningful, targeted, and scalable data visualizations in Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio, or others
* Innovative mindset ready to develop KPI and build capabilities from scratch
* Experience with or willingness to learn version control (git)

**You‚Äôll Get‚Ä¶**
 We are targeting a starting salary of $140,000 \- $160,000 based on the intended level for this role. In addition to cash compensation, our total rewards package includes:
   

  

* Full medical benefits including dental and vision plans to ensure you always have the best care.
* Equity packages in the form of stock options to all employees.
* Technology (hardware, software, reading materials, etc..) allowance

 At Dutchie, we‚Äôre committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Dutchie believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Job Number: R0227263**
 Data Analyst
   

  

**Key Role:**
 Provide QuickSight dashboard development and maintenance support, and analytical support, and contribute to overall data management. Collaborate with clients, Fiscal Service program areas or system teams, and other internal partners. Be responsible for updating and maintaining databases and dashboards in Amazon tools such as AWS S3, Glue, and QuickSight, through monthly data refreshes and data calls. Support clients on assigned projects, including custom dashboard builds, data analyses, document reviews, and report preparation.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications:**
* Experience creating dashboards, using Highcharts integration, and automating dashboard data refreshes in Amazon QuickSight
* Experience developing custom QuickSight visualizations, including using Highcharts
* Experience with JSON
* Experience with dashboard tools such as Power BI and Tableau
* Experience applying formulas, functions, and calculations for analysis
* Experience gathering, organizing, manipulating, analyzing, and tracking data
* Experience using Microsoft Office applications
* Ability to demonstrate an attention to detail
* Ability to work independently and respond to short\-turn tasking in a fast\-paced work environment
* Bachelor's degree


**Additional Qualifications:**
* Experience with Databricks and AWS
* Experience with SQL and Python
* Ability to manage and synthesize data calls
* Possession of excellent analytical and communication skills
* Possession of excellent interpersonal and organizational skills


**Compensation**
 At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well\-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work\-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full\-time and part\-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen‚Äôs benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
   

  

 Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual‚Äôs particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract\-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $62,000\.00 to $141,000\.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
   

  

**Identity Statement**
 As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.
   

  

**Work Model**
 Our people\-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
   

  

* If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you‚Äôll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
* If this position is listed as onsite, you‚Äôll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.


**Commitment to Non\-Discrimination**
 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Corporate Overview** 
  

  


**Powering Performance Marketplaces in Digital Media** 




 QuinStreet is a pioneer in powering decentralized online¬†
 **marketplaces that match searchers and ‚Äúresearch and compare‚Äù consumers with brands** 
 . We run these virtual\- and private\-label marketplaces in one of the nation‚Äôs largest media networks.
 



 Our industry leading segmentation and AI\-driven¬†
 **matching technologies help consumers find better solutions and brands faster.** 
 ¬†They allow brands to target and reach in\-market customer prospects with pinpoint segment\-by\-segment accuracy, and to pay only for performance results.
 



 Our campaign\-results\-driven matching decision engines and optimization algorithms are built from over 20 years and billions of dollars of online media experience.
 



 We believe in:
 


* The direct measurability of digital media.
* Performance marketing. (We pioneered it.)
* The advantages of technology.



 We bring all this together to deliver truly great results for consumers and brands in the world‚Äôs biggest channel.
 



 ¬†
 



**Job Category** 




 In this role you will become an expert on optimal performance and strategy of digital marketing campaigns. You will work with fellow analysts to analyze, conjecture, and manage investigations, product fixes, and optimizations to increase our yield and support our relationships with Media Partners.
 



 You will be required to develop a deep understanding of the related data sources and leverage them to inform business decisions. You will be required to develop a deep understanding of our analytical tools and the automation of business processes and decision\-making. You will need to leverage diverse problem solving strategies and balance multiple simultaneous efforts in a dynamic and high velocity environment.
 



 You will be expected to delve into business problems and analyze opportunities for growth. You will be a locus for understanding advantages, weaknesses, and deploying creative approaches to analytical problems; you will be expected to communicate these insights in an effective and timely manner, responding to the analytical needs of the business, and delivering actionable plans for improving our business.
 



 ¬†
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Develop a deep understanding of the related data sources and leverage them to inform business decisions
* Develop a deep understanding of our analytical tools and the automation of business processes and decision\-making
* Leverage diverse problem solving strategies and balance multiple simultaneous efforts in a dynamic and high velocity environment
* Dive into business problems and analyze opportunities for growth
* You will be a locus for understanding advantages, weaknesses, and deploying creative approaches to analytical problems
* Communicate these insights in an effective and timely manner, responding to the analytical needs of the business, and delivering actionable plans for improving our business.



**Requirements** 



* 3\+years of experience in an analytical role is required
* Inquisitive mindset that is willing to challenge status quo and various stakeholders
* Ability to digest disparate datasets and visualize key trends or takeaways from raw datasets
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to synthesize key takeaways and present data\-proven results
* Strong analytical, organizational and problem\-solving skills including abnormality detection, predictive analysis, market segmentation, and competitive analysis.
* Experience in using SQL with enterprise datasets is required
* Experience in R or Python is required
* Experience with Tableau or other related Business Intelligence Tool is required
* Experience with automation in an enterprise setting is a major place



 The expected salary range for this position is $80,000 USD to $140,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company‚Äôs compensation practices. The salary may be adjusted based on applicant's geographic location. The position is also eligible to receive performance bonus or commission and equity in the form of restricted stock units. This position is eligible to participate in the Company‚Äôs standard employee benefits programs, which currently include health care benefits; (2\) retirement benefits; (3\) the amount of paid days off (paid sick leave, parental leave, paid time off, or vacation benefits); (4\) any other tax\-reportable benefits.
 
 ¬†
 

 ¬†
 
 QuinStreet is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy status, sex, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.
 



 Please see QuinStreet‚Äôs Employee Privacy Notice here.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**About Us** 





 AE Strategies is a Mclean, VA based consulting firm, founded in 2003, providing management consulting to federal clients. We are a proven small business with an established reputation and a track record of supporting critical initiatives across a wide range of federal clients. Employees will work on challenging and impactful federal initiatives in a positive and collaborative work environment with competitive compensation and benefits and a collaborative and supportive company culture that is designed to support client success and employee development. Find out more at
 
 www.aestrategies.com
 
 .
 




  





**Scope of Responsibilities** 





 The Data Analyst will join an established AE Strategies team to support a Department of the Air Force supply chain headquarters office. This position requires a full\-time presence with the ability to work on site 2\-3 times a week at Hill Air Force Base in Ogden, UT. Specific responsibilities include the following:
 



* Consolidate data from different sources
* Collaborate on code using Git
* Provide technical workflow development and configuration
* Develop expertise in AE‚Äôs clients and customer data, and support customers as an AE data expert
* Develop and maintain documentation such as tailored user guide reference materials
* Conduct research and develop quantitative analytic reports using a wide range of tools and orally present data\-driven findings in a concise manner to internal teams and government officials.
* Demonstrate knowledge in areas such as US Government programs and operations, federal acquisitions and program management, government procurement practices, federal contracting, and supply chain risk management.



  





**Required Qualifications** 



* US Citizenship
* Ability to obtain a U.S. Secret security clearance



  





**Required Skills** 



* Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or 1\-3 years of equivalent experience
* Beginner to Intermediate skills with Excel, SQL, and Python
* Ability to read and understand business requirements and ETL workflows
* Excellent professional demeanor with a willingness to work outside of your comfort zone in a fast\-paced environment
* Outstanding listening, verbal, and written communication skills
* Ability to manage multiple workstreams and projects, learn quickly, and work independently



**Desired Skills** 



* Current possession of a U.S. security clearance
* Knowledge of the defense acquisition life cycle and supply chain management
* Knowledge of Python data packages such as Pandas, PySpark, and Polars
* History of engaging with and presenting to federal Government stakeholders



  





*AE Strategies is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Data Analyst - Retail Energy
description:
**Data Analyst**
**About The Team**
 Capco‚Äôs Data Team helps our clients transform every aspect of their business. We are highly skilled at formulating data strategy, defining business and technology initiatives across the data management lifecycle, and aligning multi\-year strategic roadmaps with client‚Äôs business goals. As digital technologies advance and regulations tighten, today‚Äôs consumers ‚Äì and, therefore, today‚Äôs businesses ‚Äì are becoming more aware of the importance of good quality data. We work to establish holistic ways to effectively manage data through the modern data supply chain and facilitate consumption through analytics, modelling, AI, machine learning, dashboarding, and reporting.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a member of our Data Team within our retail energy group, you will work across Capco‚Äôs different domains and solution offerings to help break down large problems, develop approaches and solutions. As a Data Analyst, you will contribute to data migration projects for retail energy providers, focusing on extracting, transforming, validating, and loading client data into target platforms
   

  

**What You‚Äôll Get To Do**
* Analyze large datasets from retail energy providers, including customer usage, pricing, products, transactions, invoices, and operational metrics
* Build and maintain ETL pipelines using SSIS or Azure Data Factory to stage and migrate data
* Write advanced SQL to cleanse, join, and transform data within staging databases
* Collaborate with client SMEs to document field\-level mappings and transformation logic
* Perform unit testing, reconciliations, and exception reporting to ensure accuracy and completeness
* Populate client\-specified load templates and prepare data for platform imports
* Identify data issues and suggest improvements to enhance migration quality and efficiency


**What You‚Äôll Bring With You**
* 3\+ years in data migration or data analytics, retail energy experience required
* Strong SQL skills and experience with ETL tools (SSIS, ADF/Azure Data Factory)
* Familiarity with Python, R, or similar scripting languages
* Knowledge of retail energy data (customers, pricing, transactions)
* Effective communicator and collaborative team player
* Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a technical or analytical field; consulting experience preferred


**Why Capco?**
 A career at Capco is a chance to help reshape the competitive landscape in financial services. We launch new banks, transform existing ones, and help our clients navigate complex change. As consultants, we work on the front\-end business design all the way through to technology implementation.
   

  

 We are the largest Financial Services focused consultancy in the world, serving everyone from global banks to emerging FinTechs, from strategy through digital transformation, design, business consulting, data and analytics, cyber, cloud, technology architecture, and engineering.
   

  

 Capco is a young and growing firm. We maintain an entrepreneurial spirit and growth mindset and have minimal bureaucracy. We have no internal silos that get in the way of your career opportunities or ability to focus on our clients and make a difference to the business. We offer the opportunity for everyone to learn rapidly, take on tough challenges, and get promoted quickly. We take pride in our creative, collaborative, diverse, and inclusive culture, where everyone can \#BYAW.
   

  

 We offer highly competitive benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan, tuition reimbursement, and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.
   

  

**Ready to take the Next Step?**
 If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. This is an opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a highly successful company with a significant growth trajectory.
   

  

 We have been informed of several recruitment scams targeting the public. We strongly advise you to verify identities before engaging in recruitment related communication. All official Capco communication will be conducted via a Capco recruiter.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**About The Company**
 Northwestern Mutual is a renowned financial services organization with a rich history spanning over 160 years. The company specializes in helping families and businesses achieve financial security through a comprehensive approach that combines risk management, wealth accumulation, preservation, and distribution strategies. With assets exceeding $290 billion, revenues surpassing $30 billion, and more than $1\.9 trillion in life insurance protection in force, Northwestern Mutual serves over 4\.6 million clients nationwide. The organization prides itself on its commitment to integrity, client\-centric solutions, and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. Recognized consistently as one of the most admired companies in the nation, Northwestern Mutual is dedicated to empowering its employees and clients alike, emphasizing innovation, collaboration, and excellence in all endeavors.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Specialty Markets Data Analyst Intern role at Northwestern Mutual offers a unique opportunity for aspiring data professionals to gain hands\-on experience within a leading financial organization. As a Summer Intern, you will support our Advanced Markets function, working closely with your hiring manager, mentor, and team to undertake critical tasks that contribute directly to the company's success. This internship is designed to provide a comprehensive learning experience, combining practical data analysis with professional development activities such as workshops, leadership Q\&A sessions, volunteer initiatives, and networking events.
   

  

 Your primary responsibilities will include conducting market analysis related to corporate and bank markets, particularly involving BOLI, COLI, and estate life insurance products. You will be responsible for validating market databases, analyzing data, documenting requests, and preparing reports for key stakeholders. Additionally, you'll have the opportunity to identify areas where automation can improve data capturing, analysis, and reporting processes, utilizing visualization tools to present insights effectively. This role is ideal for individuals passionate about data analysis, eager to develop their skills, and interested in making a tangible impact within a dynamic financial environment.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To be considered for this internship, candidates should be incoming seniors expected to graduate in May 2027, pursuing a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Business, or a related field from an accredited institution. Applicants should have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3\.0 or higher. Prior experience with SQL, Power BI, and Excel functions for data analysis is essential. Candidates with previous work or academic experience in data visualization, probability, statistics, or finance will be preferred. Note that Northwestern Mutual does not offer employer immigration sponsorship for this role.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conduct comprehensive market analysis involving BOLI, COLI, and estate life insurance products, ensuring data accuracy and database validation.
* Analyze data sets, document requests, and prepare reports for various stakeholders, supporting ongoing programs and initiatives.
* Identify opportunities to automate data collection, analysis, and reporting processes, leveraging visualization tools to enhance clarity and efficiency.
* Collaborate with team members to interpret data trends and provide actionable insights.
* Assist in the development of dashboards and visualizations to communicate complex data effectively.
* Participate in professional development workshops, leadership Q\&A sessions, and networking events to enhance industry knowledge and skills.
* Support senior team members in ad\-hoc data analysis projects as needed.


**Benefits**
 Northwestern Mutual offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to support the growth and well\-being of its interns. Interns will have access to flexible work schedules, enabling a balanced approach to work and study commitments. The organization provides concierge services, health and wellness programs, and opportunities to participate in employee resource groups that promote diversity and inclusion. Interns will also benefit from professional development workshops, mentorship programs, and networking events that foster career growth and personal development. Compensation for this internship ranges from $16\.50 to $30\.00 per hour, with salaries determined based on academic standing and major, reflecting the company's commitment to fairness and transparency. This experience provides a solid foundation for building a successful career in data analysis and finance within a supportive and innovative environment.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity
   

  

 Northwestern Mutual is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. The company is committed to creating an environment where all employees and interns can contribute their unique perspectives, ideas, and experiences. Northwestern Mutual does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. The organization believes that a diverse workforce enhances innovation, decision\-making, and overall success. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment or internship opportunities, and Northwestern Mutual encourages individuals from all backgrounds to apply and join its community of talented professionals dedicated to making a meaningful difference in clients' lives.

title: Data Annotator
description:
We‚Äôre ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company helping clients bring groundbreaking ideas to life‚Äîfrom advancing space exploration and life\-saving medical devices to building autonomous electric vehicles. With 3,000\+ experts across North America, we partner with leading companies in aerospace, medical devices, robotics, automotive, commercial vehicles, EVs, rail, and more.
 



 As part of the global ALTEN Group‚Äî57,000\+ engineers in 30 countries‚Äîwe deliver across the entire product development cycle, from consulting to full project outsourcing.
 



 When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you‚Äôll collaborate on some of the world‚Äôs toughest engineering challenges, supported by mentorship, career growth opportunities, and comprehensive benefits. We take pride in fostering a culture where employees feel valued, supported, and inspired to grow.
 



 Goal\- This position requires a detail\-oriented individual to annotate high\-quality data for our robotic platforms, contributing to the advancement of our cutting\-edge technology in various industries.
 



 RESPONSIBILITIES

* Run basic commands on a terminal for data collection

* Use software tools for data processing and analysis

* Follow structured annotation guidelines and protocols
* Maintain organized documentation of annotation work
* Track annotation progress and maintain version control
* Identify and flag problematic or edge case data
* Basic data cleaning and validation tasks
* Work with various data formats (JSON, CSV, YAML)



 Hardware \-¬†
 


* Operate and maintain robotic platforms during data collection sessions
* Work with motion capture setups for precise data gathering
* Handle Vision Pro headsets and related equipment with care
* Contribute to the improvement of data collection methodologies



 REQUIRED SKILLS:¬†
 


* Experience running basic commands on a terminal
* Basic computer literacy and file management skills
* Ability to follow detailed instructions consistently
* Strong organizational skills
* Good documentation habits
* Strong attention to detail



 PREFERRED SKILLS:¬†
 


* Experience operating in a Sim Environment
* Experience operating robots
* Experience with data collection or annotations
* Experience using Slack to communicate with team
* Experience working in a work management program like Asana or Jira



 ¬†
 



**Salary Range: $64,000\-$74,000**

 ¬†
 





 The actual salary offered is dependent on various factors including, but not limited to, location, the candidate‚Äôs combination of job\-related knowledge, qualifications, skills, education, training, and experience
 

 ¬†
 




 ALTEN Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our Policy is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual‚Äôs age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status.
 



***Please beware of job seeker scams and see this important notice on our careers page for more information about our recruiting process.***




**Compliance Notice:** 
 Alten USA is a federal contractor subject to the requirements of the Vietnam Era Veterans‚Äô Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) and Executive Order 11246\. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
 



**Drug Screening Requirement:** 
 As a federal contractor, Alten USA maintains a drug\-free workplace. All candidates selected for employment will be required to successfully complete a pre\-employment drug screening as a condition of hire.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Title:** 
 BI Reporting Analyst
   

**Duration:** 
 Direct\-hire
   

**Location:** 
 Onsite, Denver metro
   

**Salary Range:** 
 100\-120K
   

  




 Summary
   

  


 The BI Reporting Analyst will transform raw data into actionable insights that support smarter business decisions. This role involves collaborating with stakeholders to understand reporting needs, ensuring data integrity, and translating business requirements into technical solutions. The analyst will be responsible for connecting to various data sources, preparing and modeling data, and delivering impactful dashboards and visualizations that clearly communicate trends and performance metrics.

title: Healthcare Data & Analytics Specialist
description:
***\*\*\*U.S. Citizens only\*\*\****




  





**Healthcare Data \& Analytics Specialist** 




  





 We‚Äôre looking for a data\-driven professional to transform clinical and operational information into actionable insights that improve patient care, streamline operations, and ensure compliance with healthcare standards. This role partners closely with clinicians, IT teams, and administrators to support data\-informed decision\-making across the organization.
 



  





**What You‚Äôll Do** 



* Examine and interpret clinical and operational datasets to guide strategic and operational decisions.
* Build interactive dashboards, visualizations, and reports using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, Python, or R.
* Detect patterns, trends, and opportunities in healthcare data to enhance outcomes and efficiency.
* Contribute to quality improvement efforts by evaluating clinical performance metrics against benchmarks.
* Maintain data accuracy, integrity, and adherence to regulations like HIPAA, HEDIS, and CMS standards.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to design data\-driven solutions for healthcare challenges.
* Support predictive analytics and risk stratification initiatives to advance patient care.
* Document analyses, insights, and recommendations clearly for both technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Keep up with innovations, emerging technologies, and best practices in healthcare analytics.
* Provide excellent support to colleagues and contribute to a culture of collaboration.
* Perform additional responsibilities as needed.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a healthcare\-related field, data science, or a similar discipline.
* 2‚Äì3 years of hands\-on experience analyzing clinical or healthcare information.
* Familiar with electronic health records, claims datasets, or healthcare quality reporting processes.
* Understanding of medical coding and data standards such as ICD\-10, CPT, LOINC, and HL7\.
* Exposure to predictive modeling, machine learning, or healthcare analytics is a plus.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
**About the Opportunity** 




 Thrively is partnering with a category\-leading, PE\-backed healthcare technology company transforming how data flows between dental providers and payers. Our client processes claims at national scale and is modernizing a complex, high\-volume data ecosystem on Azure/Databricks with Power BI on the front end.
 



  





 As the Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll be the steward of trusted data designing rules, tests, and monitoring that keep pipelines healthy and analytics reliable. You‚Äôll collaborate across Data, Engineering, and Operations to turn messy, multi\-source healthcare data into accurate, well\-documented, self\-service insights.
 



  





**Position Summary** 




 You will own the definition, implementation, and visibility of data quality across the lakehouse and downstream BI. From profiling and reconciliation to automated testing and issue triage, you‚Äôll make data quality measurable and repeatable so the business can move faster with confidence.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Partner with stakeholders to translate business rules into concrete data quality requirements and SLAs.
* Profile source and curated datasets; define and implement rules for accuracy, completeness, validity, and uniqueness.
* Build automated validation tests (e.g., SQL/PySpark/dbt\-style checks) and stand up continuous monitoring with alerting/runbooks.
* Investigate anomalies (human \+ technical), perform root\-cause analysis, and drive corrective/preventive actions.
* Reconcile high\-volume healthcare/EDI datasets across systems; document lineage, assumptions, and metadata in the catalog.
* Create simple quality dashboards in Power BI to expose data health, trend issues, and track remediation.
* Collaborate with data engineers on pipeline hardening (Azure Data Factory/Databricks/SQL), CI/CD, and deployment hygiene.
* Champion best practices for secure handling of sensitive data and compliance (least\-necessary access, auditability).



  





**What Makes This Company Stand Out** 




 This is a scaled, profitable platform with a people\-first culture that‚Äôs curious, collaborative, and low\-ego. Leadership is investing deeply in a modern data stack (Azure Lakehouse \+ Databricks \+ Power BI) and in the processes that make self\-service analytics real: governance, quality, and documentation. Your work will directly improve provider experiences and patient outcomes.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor‚Äôs in Data Analytics, CS, Statistics, MIS, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 4\+ years in a dedicated data quality/analytics engineering/BI QA role, ideally with high\-volume operational data.
* Strong SQL (T\-SQL/BigQuery/Snowflake SQL) for profiling, reconciliation, and test automation; familiarity with PySpark a plus.
* Hands\-on with Azure data services (Data Lake/Synapse or Databricks) and modern ELT concepts; experience with ADF preferred.
* Proficiency building QA/health dashboards in Power BI; ability to read DAX for validation coverage.
* Clear communicator who can document rules/definitions, explain trade\-offs, and align diverse stakeholders.
* Nice to have: Healthcare/dental EDI (837/835/270/271/276/277/275\), data catalog/governance tools, HIPAA/PHI best practices, dbt\-style testing.



  





 Thrively specializes in matching exceptional data talent with high\-impact roles. Our team has scaled data organizations inside high\-growth companies. We‚Äôll advocate for you, keep the process transparent, and help you land where your work (and career) can thrive.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
Witherite Law Group (WLG) is a personal injury law firm specializing in motor vehicle accidents. Our vision is to improve the life of each person we serve. Whether it is for our employees, our clients, or our community, WLG puts people first, provides unmatched expertise, and displays integrity in every situation.
   

  

 Our attorneys and staff are committed to helping injured clients get the care and service they deserve. We take care of the complex legal work so that our clients can focus on recovery and getting their lives back. We are‚ÄØdetermined to help our clients get the settlement they deserve, and we will be by our client‚Äôs side every step of the way.
   

  

 This firm is a Top 100 Places to Work recipient and a National Top Workplace honoree. We are proud of these achievements and honored to be among this prestigious list of companies. Our culture is special. But you can‚Äôt just take our word for it...apply today and join the WLG family.
   

  

**Position Summary:** 
 As a Data Governance Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data governance policies and procedures to ensure the integrity, security, and effective use of our data across various systems. You will lead data governance initiatives, working closely with cross\-functional departments and leadership to ensure compliance with data governance standards and support our core systems. Additionally, you will focus on optimizing data quality, integrity, and compliance while overseeing the management and implementation of key data management practices, including potential team leadership.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop, implement, and maintain data governance policies, procedures, and standards to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
* Lead and manage data governance and MDM initiatives, collaborating with various departments to promote best practices and support organizational goals.
* Monitor, report on, and improve data governance metrics and performance across the organization.
* Provide training and ongoing support to staff on data governance policies and procedures.
* Work with vendors and internal teams to optimize data management tools, processes, and systems, ensuring alignment with governance standards.
* Support the management and optimization of principal systems (e.g., ERP, HRIS, case management systems like Filevine) to maintain data integrity.
* Assist with the integration of data management software and tools, such as Palantir, Data Sentinel, Qlik, and ETL tools.
* Potentially lead a team to ensure efficient execution of data governance initiatives and the overall quality of data systems.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or a related field
* Minimum of 3\+ years of experience in data governance, MDM, or a related field
* Preferably 2\+ years of experience in a law firm environment
* Previous exposure to case management systems such as Filevine is a plus
* Proficiency with data management software and tools, including Palantir, Data Sentinel, Qlik, and ETL tools
* Strong understanding of data governance principles, best practices, and the ability to apply them to organizational systems
* Excellent analytical, problem\-solving, communication, and collaboration skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation
* Previous management experience is highly desirable


**Physical Requirements** 
 :
   

  

* Office environment with normal business hours necessary to satisfactorily perform job functions.
* Stationary Position ‚Äì Must be able to remain in a stationary position up to 50% of the time.
* Move or Traverse ‚Äì This position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, meeting rooms, office machinery, etc. May occasionally ascends/descends the stairs to get to other floors, cafeteria and parking area.
* Dexterity ‚Äì constantly operates a computer and other office machinery such as a copy machine/printer.
* Move, Transport, Position, Put, Install, Remove \- Occasionally moves supplies weighing up to 10 pounds for various presentation and event needs.
* Communicate, Detect, Converse with, Discern, Convey, Express oneself, Exchange information \- The ability to communicate information and ideas so others will understand. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.
* Detect, Determine, Perceive, Identify, Recognize, Judge, Observe, Inspect, Estimate, Assess \- The ability to observe details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).


**Benefits and Perks:**
* Medical, dental, vision
* Company paid Life and AD\&D Insurance
* Company Paid STD (with no waiting period) and LTD Insurance
* Option to purchase additional Life and AD\&D Insurance
* Voluntary Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital Indemnity Coverage
* 401(k) with company contributions
* Paid Time Off
* 10 Company Holidays
* Tuition Reimbursement


 Please note that this job description is intended to outline the primary duties of the role and is not intended to be an exhaustive list. The job description is subject to change with or without prior notice, and that a reasonable accommodation may be requested to perform the essential functions of the job.
   

  

*WLG and its affiliated companies provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*
*WLG and its affiliated companies participate in E\-Verify. For additional information please review the E\-Verify Participation Poster and Right to Work Poster from the Department of Homeland Security.*

title: Analyst, Machine Learning
description:
**Job Overview**
 We are seeking a high\-potential, entry\-level Analyst, AI/ML with a passion for applying artificial intelligence to real\-world business problems. The Analyst, AI/ML will assist in identifying and understanding business opportunities, exploring the latest AI/ML trends and offerings, and support the delivery of end\-to\-end solutions ‚Äî from concept to benefit realization.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Passionate about manufacturing, with a commitment to leverage AI to improve processes and drive efficiency.
* Stay on top of cutting\-edge AI/ML tools, frameworks, and applications to assist in the identification of relevant opportunities for the business.
* Assist in the design, development, and deployment of AI/ML models and solutions for real\-world use cases.
* Support projects from problem definition, data gathering, and modeling to deployment and monitoring.
* Document clean and efficient code for AI/ML pipelines, APIs, and integrations.
* Work closely with business teams to understand challenges and propose AI\-driven solutions.
* Share knowledge through demos, presentations, and internal training to foster an AI mindset.
* Learn, ascertain applicability, and apply your knowledge to GLC with new products in the AI space.
* Ability to multi\-task and succeed in a lean working environment with minimal supervision bringing in the ownership culture.


**Required Education And Experience**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, AI/ML, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience), or a high school diploma with 4 years of relevant experience in lieu of a degree.
* Understanding of applied AI concepts (supervised/unsupervised learning, NLP, computer vision, generative AI, etc.).
* Proficiency in general\-purpose programming languages (Python preferred; familiarity with Java, C\+\+, or JavaScript is a plus).
* Experience with AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit\-learn, or Hugging Face.
* Understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
* Self\-driven, curious, and able to learn new tools quickly.
* Automate data refreshes and ensure real\-time or near\-real\-time availability for AI/ML initiatives.
* Strong intuition for understanding datasets and skillfully chooses visualizations that best convey the story behind the data.
* Proficient in MSSQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate data concepts clearly to non\-technical stakeholders.


**Preferred Education And Experience**
* 0\-2 years of relevant experience.
* Internships at organizations where you displayed real work AI knowledge and capabilities.
* Academic projects, or personal projects applying AI to solve real\-world problems.
* Exposure to cloud AI platforms (eg Azure, AWS).
* Exposure to ERP (SAP, Oracle, etc.) and Shop Floor (Aveva, Rockwell) systems.
* Familiarity with modern development workflows (Git, CI/CD).


**Working Conditions**
* Occasional exposure to industrial operations including: temperature extremes from approximately 35¬∫F to 100¬∫F; noise levels in excess of 85 dB; moisture and moving machinery.
* Work is performed in an office setting.


**EEOC \& Disclaimer**
 Great Lakes Cheese is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer.
