title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Job Title: Data Quality Analyst
 



  





 Location: Overland Park, KS
 



  





 On\-site Requirement: 5 days a week, on\-site
 



  





**Summary** 




 The Data Quality Analyst ensures the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of the data that powers operations, reporting, and strategic decisions. This role develops and executes data validation processes, monitors key quality metrics, and partners with internal teams and external custodians to resolve discrepancies. By maintaining high standards of data integrity, the analyst directly supports advisor efficiency, reporting accuracy, and overall growth.
 



  





**Qualifications, Skills and Requirements** 



* Develop and execute data testing strategies to validate accuracy, completeness, and consistency across custodial and portfolio management systems.
* Monitor and report on data quality metrics, proactively identifying and resolving issues to maintain a 99%\+ accuracy standard.
* Perform root cause analysis on recurring issues and recommend process or system improvements.
* Create and maintain documentation for data validation rules, QA procedures, and reporting standards.
* Collaborate with Operations, Compliance, and Technology teams to resolve discrepancies and support reporting, analytics, and decision\-making.
* Act as a subject matter resource for custodial integrations (e.g., Schwab, Fidelity, Raymond James) and portfolio management platforms (e.g., Orion Advisor Tech, Tamarac, Black Diamond).
* Support onboarding by ensuring accurate and timely system integrations. Address escalated issues by independently researching or coordinating with custodians, vendors, and advisors.
* Lead or participate in projects that may require long\-term goals, milestones, and cross\-functional collaboration.
* Foster strong relationships with internal teams to ensure data integrity supports field and client success.



  





**Education, Training and Experience** 



* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field preferred.
* 4‚Äì6 years of business experience in financial services or investment industry required.
* 2\+ years of experience in data quality, data governance, or QA testing preferred.
* Experience with custodial platforms (Schwab, Fidelity, Raymond James) strongly preferred.
* Experience with advisor technology platforms (Orion, Tamarac, Black Diamond) preferred.
* Strong technical expertise with custodial systems, portfolio management software, and data integrations.
* Proven ability to manage projects, timelines, and vendor relationships.
* Familiarity with regulatory standards applicable to RIAs and broker/dealers.
* Proficiency in Excel, reporting tools, and database management.
* Excellent communication and problem\-solving skills; able to work independently and collaboratively.
* Strong knowledge of compliance standards within the RIA environment.
* Full knowledge and understanding of basic investment terms and account types.
* Ability to balance detailed execution with high\-level strategic initiatives.



  





**Other** 



* Regular and predictable attendance required.
* Primarily sedentary work with extensive computer use.
* Occasional travel to industry conferences (1‚Äì3 times per year).
* Role involves access to highly confidential financial and client data; discretion is essential.
* Attention to detail, accuracy, and strong critical thinking are required.

title: Clinical Data Specialist I (Remote)
description:
**Overview**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 The Clinical Data Specialist I needs a strong understanding of the products offered at Myriad and the clinical histories that are appropriate for each product. They will ensure that appropriate testing was performed as requested by the health care provider and contact providers to resolve any issues prior to testing. They will review all test results in conjunction with clinical histories and ensure the best possible patient care was given to each and every patient prior to sending out a report to the health care provider. Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and strong work ethic are essential to being successful.
   

  

***This is a technical position. You must have a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in a biological, chemical laboratory science or medical technology area in order to qualify.***
**Shift:** 
 Weekdays with the option of 5x8's or 4x10's
   

  

**Pay:** 
 $25/hr
   

  

**Responsibility**
 The Clinical Data Specialist I (CDS I) role is responsible for:
   

  

  

* Evaluating the clinical history of a patient in context to the test as it is first ordered and then performed together with the test results.
* Generating reports and querying in\-house data bases and on\-line resources to provide information about individual patient‚Äôs genetic test results and to answer questions about cumulative statistics pertaining to genetic test results.
* Performing clinical data entry and validation to ensure completeness and accuracy of data.
* Recognizing inconsistencies and initiating resolution of data problems.
* Assisting Research Coordinator in research collaborations with academic investigators for product development.


 Each employee‚Äôs specific job responsibilities are uniquely defined by their individual training plan and assigned duties, but are generally defined as follows:
   

  

**Reporting:**
* Check all reports in a timely, error\-free manner to maintain the goals of production.
* Generate manual and/or custom reports and uncertain variant forms.


**Client Support:**
* Respond to client inquiries in a timely, expert, and effective fashion.
* Initiate appropriate contacts with clients as necessary, pre\- and post\- test.


**Clinical Knowledge:**
* Pursue continuing education and expand knowledge and skills; attend training with Medical Information Liaison (MIL) team.


**Administrative:**
* Maintain databases in an appropriate manner.


**Organizational Interactions:**
* Maintain productive and collegial relationships with other MGL departments.
* Support and assist Laboratory Directors.
* Support and assist other Medical Services groups.


**Leadership:**
* Model values of Myriad.
* Identify unmet needs and/or process improvements.


**Qualifications**
* Meets minimum education and experience requirements:
+ Doctoral, master‚Äôs, or bachelor‚Äôs degree in medical technology or a chemical, biological, or clinical laboratory science.
+ Minimum 1 year of pertinent experience and/or training.

* Preferred: Excellent communication (written and oral) skills.
* Preferred: Proficiency in Windows, Word, and Excel.


**Physical Requirements**
 Lifting Requirements ‚Äì medium work or exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, 20 pounds of force frequently, and 10 pounds of force consistently. Physical Requirements ‚Äì stationary positioning, moving, operating, ascending/descending, communicating, observing, reaching, and repetitive motion. Use of equipment and tools necessary to perform essential job functions. Hazards and Atmospheric Conditions ‚Äì exposure to fumes, dust, extreme temperatures, wet and/or humid, noise, vibration, mists or gases, mechanical hazards, chemical hazards, electrical hazards, and radiant energy hazards. OSHA Category I ‚Äì duties performed routinely requires exposure to blood, body fluid, and tissue.
   

  

 EEO
   

  

 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. In hiring and all other employment decisions, we prohibit discrimination and harassment on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

title: HRIS Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled HRIS Data Analyst to support and optimize our HR technology landscape while delivering meaningful insights through advanced data analytics. The ideal candidate will combine expertise in HR systems management with strong technical skills in Power BI, Python, SQL, and R. This role will partner with HR, IT, and business leaders to ensure data integrity, streamline HR processes, and develop analytics that drive informed decision\-making across the organization.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* HRIS Management \& Optimization
* Maintain, configure, and optimize the company‚Äôs HRIS systems to meet evolving organizational needs.
* Manage data integrity, system upgrades, testing, and documentation of processes.
* Partner with HR and IT teams to ensure smooth integration with payroll, benefits, and performance management systems.
* Data Analytics \& Reporting
* Design and build Power BI dashboards and reports to visualize workforce trends, compliance metrics, and operational KPIs.
* Use SQL, Python, and R to extract, clean, and analyze large HR datasets.
* Deliver actionable insights to HR leadership and business stakeholders through data storytelling.
* Process Improvement \& Compliance
* Automate recurring HR reports and streamline workflows to reduce manual effort.
* Support compliance reporting (EEO, OFCCP, GDPR, etc.) and ensure HR data governance.
* Partner with HR leadership to recommend process improvements based on analytics.
* Cross\-Functional Collaboration
* Serve as the main point of contact for HR data requests across multiple departments.
* Provide technical support and training for HR team members on reporting tools and HRIS functionalities.



  





 Qualifications
 


* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or related field.
* 3‚Äì5 years of experience in HRIS administration and HR data analytics.
* Strong proficiency in SQL, Power BI, Python, and R with the ability to handle complex datasets.
* Experience with one or more major HRIS platforms (Workday, UKG, Dayforce, SAP SuccessFactors, ADP, Oracle HCM, etc.).
* Understanding of HR processes, compliance requirements, and data governance best practices.
* Excellent problem\-solving skills with a detail\-oriented, analytical mindset.
* Strong communication skills to present findings to both technical and non\-technical audiences.



  





 Preferred Skills
 


* Experience integrating HRIS with payroll, benefits, and ATS systems.
* Familiarity with cloud data environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
* Knowledge of advanced statistical modeling, forecasting, or machine learning techniques applied to HR data.

title: Power BI Report Writer
description:
We are seeking a skilled and detail\-oriented Power BI Report Writer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI. This position requires a strong understanding of data management, report creation, and business intelligence tools.
 



  





 The responsibilities below capture the core of this role, but as Glass House Brands grows quickly, your scope may evolve to match new opportunities and business needs.
 



  





**What you‚Äôll do:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI.
* Collaborate with business users to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Create and optimize SQL queries to extract data from various sources.
* Ensure data accuracy and consistency in reports and dashboards.
* Monitor and troubleshoot report and dashboard performance issues.
* Provide support and training to end\-users on utilizing reports and dashboards effectively.
* Document report development processes and procedures.
* Stay current with industry trends and technologies related to business intelligence and reporting.



  





  





**What we‚Äôre looking for:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience in Power BI report writing.
* Strong proficiency in SQL, DAX, and data manipulation.
* Knowledge of data modeling and database design.
* Excellent problem\-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience with other BI tools and technologies is a plus



  





**Skills:** 



* Experience with DAX and M languages in Power BI.
* Familiarity with ETL processes and tools.
* Knowledge of data warehousing concepts.
* Understanding business processes and KPI development.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is a plus.



  





**Personal Attributes:** 



* High integrity and ethical standards.
* Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity with confidence.
* A proactive, results\-oriented approach.
* Strong commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace.



  





**Our perks:** 



* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family
* 401(k) with company match to invest in your future
* Generous paid time off and holidays
* Employee discounts on Glass House products
* Career growth opportunities in a fast\-growing, innovative industry
* A culture built on inclusion, collaboration, and celebrating wins



  





**Commitment Statement** 




  





 Glass House Brands is a rapidly growing, vertically integrated, California\-focused organization that strives every day to fulfill its vision of excellence: compelling cannabis brands, produced sustainably, for the benefit of all. Led by expert operators, proven business leaders, and passionate plant lovers, we are dedicated to delivering rich cannabis experiences with respect for people, the environment, and the community ‚Äî guided by an abiding commitment to justice, social equity, and sustainability.
 



  





 As an employer, GH Group Inc. is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals. We ensure fair consideration for all applicants regardless of race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

title: Analyst, Marketing Data
description:
****Company Description****
 NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world\-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad\-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world\-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations \& Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.
   

  

 Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.
   

  

 Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('Versant') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well\-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure\-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin\-off is expected to be completed during 2025\.
   

  

****Job Description****
 Fandango is looking for a highly talented individual to join the Product \& Marketing Analytics team. The team is responsible for providing deep analysis of the performance of Fandango‚Äôs portfolio of sites and apps. The ideal candidate will have exceptional quantitative skills, a passion for data analysis, and the ability to synthesize learnings into actionable insights.
   

  

 A Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help businesses make informed marketing decisions. They use various data sources and analytical techniques to measure campaign performance, customer behavior, and market trends.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Collect and analyze marketing data from multiple sources (Adobe Analytics, social media, CRM, email marketing platforms, etc.).
* Build/maintain revenue\-focused reports and dashboards to monitor the performance of our Paid, CRM, OTT (e.g. Roku, Vizio, Samsung), and trade marketing campaigns
* Develop reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and campaign effectiveness.
* Identify trends and insights to optimize marketing strategies and improve ROI.
* Measure A/B testing, customer segmentation, and predictive modeling to enhance targeting and personalization.
* Partner with Marketing teams to solve problems, identify trends and opportunities, and provide data\-driven recommendations
* Use analytics tools and data visualization techniques to present findings in a clear and actionable way.
* Monitor and assess competitor activities and market trends to identify new opportunities.
* Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by maintaining proper data governance practices.
* Provide analysis and support for marketing and product teams
* Deliver persuasive presentations that simplify complex analyses into actionable insights and recommendations
* Media mix modeling or multi\-touch attribution modeling experience
* Support ad hoc projects as necessary
* Be curious: Proactively look at data to come up with insights that can help drive growth


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or other relevant field
* Strong proficiency with SQL
* Advanced spreadsheet skills


****Qualifications****
 Desired Characteristics
   

  

* Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
* Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
* Basic understanding of statistical analysis and/or machine learning (e.g. classification \& clustering techniques, regression modeling, etc.)
* Experience analyzing user behavior across digital, consumer\-facing products (e.g. entertainment, e\-commerce, etc.)
* Intellectual curiosity and a passion for media
* Technical skill and experience with Python, R, Tableau, Looker, Amazon Redshift, and/or Adobe Analytics


 Additional Information
   

  

* Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week. Subject to change based on Manager discussion or business need.
* This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other benefits and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.
* Salary range: $62,000 \- $80,000


****Additional Information****
 As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in\-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
   

  

 NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories, or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable.
   

  

 If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.
   

  

 Although you'll be hired as an NBCU employee, your employment and the responsibilities associated with this job likely will transition to Versant in the future. By joining at this pivotal time, you'll be a part of this exciting company as it takes shape.

title: Data Analyst for Technical Operations
description:

 Featherstone Sourcing is proud to be partnering with
 **Blooming Health** 
 , a fast\-growing Series A health\-tech startup transforming how social and healthcare organizations deliver care. We‚Äôre looking for a
 **Data Analyst** 
 eager to launch or accelerate their career in analytics, with the opportunity to work hands\-on with large\-scale healthcare data, modern cloud technologies, and a mission\-driven team.
 



**About the Role** 




 The Data Analyst will play a critical role in supporting Blooming Health‚Äôs data\-driven decision making. This position is designed for early\-career professionals who want to build strong foundations in analytics while contributing directly to real\-world healthcare outcomes. You‚Äôll work closely with senior analysts, engineers, and product managers to collect, analyze, and present data that powers Blooming Health‚Äôs strategy.
 



 Key Responsibilities
 


* Collect, clean, and transform data from multiple sources (BigQuery, PostgreSQL, MongoDB) using Python (Pandas, Polars, NumPy).
* Build and maintain robust data models and workflows to enable reporting in BigQuery and visualization in Tableau.
* Write efficient SQL queries across PostgreSQL and MongoDB to extract and manipulate complex datasets.
* Collaborate with data analysts, product managers, and engineers to deliver trusted data products.
* Apply healthcare domain knowledge, with strict adherence to HIPAA and data privacy standards.
* Document data sources, transformations, and workflows for transparency and reproducibility.
* Support customer\-facing teams (Customer Success, Sales) with dashboards, reporting, and user setup.
* Investigate and resolve bugs to ensure smooth data operations.



**Skills \& Experience** 



* Strong proficiency in
 **PostgreSQL and Python** 
 (especially Pandas).
* Hands\-on experience with
 **Google Cloud Platform** 
 (BigQuery, Cloud SQL).
* Familiarity with MongoDB and unstructured/semi\-structured healthcare data.
* Understanding of HIPAA regulations and secure patient data handling.
* Experience with
 **Tableau dashboards and reporting** 
 .
* Excellent problem\-solving and communication skills, with the ability to work independently in a fast\-paced environment.
* Prior healthcare data experience is strongly preferred.



**Training \& Mentorship** 




 Blooming Health invests in your growth:
 


* SMART performance metrics reviewed by month 3 and annually.
* Structured training materials (documents, videos, walkthroughs).
* Direct mentorship from the Technical Manager and senior team members.



**Career Development** 




 This role offers a clear path to senior analytics positions (Senior Data Analyst, Data Scientist) with ongoing training, performance reviews, and exposure to cross\-functional projects.
 



**Benefits \& Compensation** 



* Salary range:
 **$85,000 ‚Äì $105,000**
* **Equity** 
 in a Series A startup
* **Healthcare \& vision coverage**
* **Fully remote** 
 role



 üëâ If you‚Äôre passionate about using data to make a difference in healthcare and want to grow with a mission\-driven team, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Join the Best ‚ÄúUNION‚Äù Credit Union Around!**
 In 1964, OE Federal Credit Union opened its doors to serve union members with a simple goal of providing a better alternative to banks. A credit union is more than a financial institution. We are a community, a family. Our teams are our greatest asset, we are energetic, dynamic, and passionate about assisting our members with financial wellness. Built on a foundation of union pride, OE Federal is a 1\.5 billion company and the country‚Äôs largest labor\-based credit union serving more than 115,000 members nationwide!
   

  

**Our People Make the Difference!** 
 Are you looking to take on a dynamic and challenging role? OE Federal is seeking to hire a Business Intelligence Analyst!
   

  

**Your Purpose**
 The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is a foundational role responsible for building the credit union‚Äôs analytics capabilities and helping transform raw data into actionable insights. Working across departments, including lending, marketing, operations, and IT, the BI Analyst will deliver dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that guide decision\-making and improve member experience and operational efficiency. This role will also help shape data governance, promote data literacy across the organization, and support the adoption of consistent metrics and performance tracking.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily under oversight supervision
   

  

* Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, iDashboards and Excel.
* Write and optimize SQL queries to extract data from the core system and other internal and external sources (e.g., Loan Origination System (LOS), Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Customer Experience Platform, Employee Experience Platform).
* Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and deliver insights that drive operational and strategic decisions.
* Identify trends, gaps, and opportunities in member behavior, product usage, and business performance.
* Create repeatable, accurate, and user\-friendly reporting tools for departments across the credit union.
* Work closely with the Database Administrator (DBA), Member Information System (MIS), and other data\-centric teams to ensure access to quality and timely data.
* Assist with documenting data definitions, reporting logic, and dashboard usage.
* Promote the use of data through training, communication, and data storytelling.
* Contribute to the creation of a data\-driven culture by advocating for clean, well\-structured data processes.
* Collaborate seamlessly with colleagues across departments and branches to deliver optimal and efficient service to our members and employees. Uphold a standard of professionalism actively fostering positive relationships internally and externally.
* Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the credit union‚Äôs products and services, ensuring compliance with applicable Federal and State laws, Credit Union banking regulations, and OE Federal Credit Union‚Äôs policies and procedures and current promotions.
* Perform other job duties as assigned.


**Ideal Candidate Will Possess**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Statistics, or related field with 1 year of experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, data reporting, or related role OR Associates degree in Business, Finance, Information Systems, Data Analytics, Statistics, or related field with 3 years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, data reporting, or related role required.
* Proficiency in SQL and ability to work with relational databases required.
* Experience with Power BI (or similar tools like Tableau, Looker, iDashboards, etc.) required.
* Proficiency in working with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate business needs into data solutions required.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, negotiation and presentation skills; ability to effectively interact with all levels of internal and external business partners required.
* Ability to self\-motivate and to manage multiple priorities and deliverables simultaneously required.


**Salary Range $$79,148 \- $111,954**
 OE Federal Credit Union offers competitive compensation. The offered salary considers experience, education, training, internal peer equity, job location and other business considerations when extending an offer. The salary outlined is based on working in Livermore, California. The salary range will adjust to the applicant's work location. In addition to competitive salaries
   

  

**We Offer Superior Benefits**
* Medical, dental and vision benefits that cover the employee, spouse and dependents
* Retiree medical benefits
* A defined benefit Pension Plan with 100% employer contributions of $5\.57/hour
* $10,000 Life Insurance
* $5,000 Accidental Death and Dismemberment
* 11 ¬Ω Paid Holidays per year
* 17 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) to start
* Annual Performance Bonus Program \- Up to 5% of employee‚Äôs annual base paid on December 15th of each year
* A 401(k) plan
* OE Federal Membership for you and your family
* Employee loan discounts
* Casual dress code


**Find your team, find your fit!**
 If you think this job is the right fit for you, fill out our on\-line application. Our application is pretty simple \- you upload your resume and answer a few job\-related questions. When you have completed the application, your information will be sent to our recruiting team.
   

  

 OE Federal Credit Union partners with Total Quality Consultants (TQC) to support our recruiting and hiring needs. TQC is a talent and acquisition firm acting as an extension of our HR team. When applying for a role with OE Federal, you may be contacted by TQC.

title: Data Privacy Analyst
description:
**WHO WE ARE**




 We‚Äôre not in the wing business. We‚Äôre in the flavor business. It‚Äôs been our mission to Serve the World Flavor since we first opened in 1994, and we‚Äôre just getting started. 1997 saw the opening of our first brand partner operated Wingstop location, and by 2002 we had served the world one billion wings. It‚Äôs flavor that defines us and has made Wingstop one of the fastest growing brands in the restaurant industry.
 



  





 Above all else ‚Äì our success is largely due to our people and our core values, or what we call The Wingstop Way of being entrepreneurial, service\-minded, fun, and authentic. We believe having a strong people foundation centered on these collective values creates a crave\-worthy culture and talented team, as well as ensures our brand is poised for accelerated growth. We all win together.
 



  





**WHAT WE'LL NEED**




 The Data Privacy Analyst will support the ongoing development, implementation, and daily operations of Wingstop‚Äôs global data privacy program. Reporting directly to the Data Privacy Program Manager, this early\-career role is responsible for assisting with a range of privacy compliance tasks, helping to operationalize privacy principles across systems and processes, and contributing to cross\-functional collaboration to ensure the responsible handling of personal data.
 



  





 This role is ideal for a detail\-oriented and proactive professional who is eager to grow in the privacy and data protection space. The Privacy Analyst will play a key part in supporting compliance with global data protection laws and internal privacy policies, while also helping to embed privacy practices throughout the organization.
 



  





**WHAT YOU'LL DO**




**In This Role, The Privacy Analyst Will** 



* Assist in incorporating privacy by design principles into business processes and technology initiatives by gathering requirements and coordinating with cross\-functional teams.
* Support day\-to\-day privacy operations, including intake and tracking of data subject requests (DSRs), contract reviews, data mapping activities, and privacy assessments.
* Help maintain and update privacy documentation such as policies, procedures, records of processing activities (ROPAs), and training materials.
* Contribute to the administration and configuration of data privacy tools and technologies used for cookie and other similar technologies management.
* Track and help analyze privacy metrics and incident trends to support reporting and compliance efforts.
* Assist in verifying compliance of systems and processes with internal privacy policies and regulatory obligations.
* Coordinate with IT, Security, Legal, Human Resources, and other teams to support privacy\-related requests and projects.
* Stay current on evolving privacy laws, regulations, and best practices, and summarize relevant updates for internal stakeholders as Wingstop expands into new international markets, as well as existing markets.
* Help promote a culture of privacy awareness by supporting internal training and education initiatives.



  





**WHAT YOU'LL NEED**




 To be successful in the role, the candidate will have:
 


* A passion for data privacy and working knowledge of global privacy laws and regulations (i.e CCPA, GDPR, PIPA, etc..).
* Familiarity with OneTrust ecosystem of products preferred.
* Ability to understand technical architectures, system capabilities and explain data privacy requirements to various levels of data privacy knowledge.
* Excellent report writing and presentation skills.
* Ability to work as a part of a team.
* Flexibility to change direction and manage conflicting demands.
* Outstanding organizational and data analytics skills.
* Ability to comfortably work multiple projects.



**Requirements** 



* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field such as Information Systems, Legal Studies, Cybersecurity, Business, or Compliance.
* 1‚Äì 3 years of experience in privacy, data protection, compliance, or related fields (internships acceptable).
* Foundational understanding of data protection principles and regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA/CPRA, PIPEDA, CANSPAM).
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Basic familiarity with data flows, systems, or information governance is a plus.
* Ability to clearly communicate privacy requirements in a collaborative, cross\-functional environment.
* Willingness to learn privacy technologies and tools.
* Professional certifications (e.g., CIPP/US, CIPP/E, or CIPT) are a plus but not required.



  





**WHO YOU ARE**




 No job is too small. You recognize that the real work happens in the restaurants, and everything we do should support their success. You stay humble, roll up your sleeves, and always look for ways to support. You learn from others and contribute wherever you can.
 



  





 You care deeply about doing great work and driving results. You‚Äôre curious, ask questions, and seek out opportunities to improve. You don‚Äôt just point out problems‚Äîyou bring solutions, ideas, and perspectives that move the team forward.
 



  





 You take full responsibility for your work and see things through to completion. You aren‚Äôt afraid to fail because you know that failure is a part of learning and growth. You take action, move fast, and keep pushing forward.
 



  





 You lead with empathy, respect, and emotional intelligence. You collaborate effectively, fostering a culture of trust and constructive feedback. You understand the importance of teamwork and ensure that your actions build others up rather than break them down.
 



  





 You push yourself and others to be better. You embrace healthy conflict, knowing that great ideas and strong teams emerge from honest, constructive conversations. You believe that leaders create leaders and are committed to fostering a culture of growth, challenge, and continuous improvement.
 



  





  





**BENEFITS**




**Flavor Perks:** 



* Unlimited paid time off for exempt employees
* One paid volunteer day of your choice
* Competitive bonus structure for eligible roles
* Team member stock purchase plan
* Health savings or flexible spending account options
* 401k ‚Äì (dollar for dollar on the first 3% and then 50 cents on the dollar for the next 2% for team member contributions up to 5% of eligible compensation)
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Basic life and AD\&D insurance provided
* Pet insurance
* Education Assistance
* Wellness reimbursement program
* Paid maternity and paternity leave



  





**Fun Is The Best Flavor:** 



* Lunch provided every Tuesday and Thursday in the office
* Work from home Fridays
* Discount on Wingstop gift cards
* Onsite game room



  





 Wingstop provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Data Engineer
description:
As part of the Data Engineering team, you will play a key role in enabling company wide data informed decision making. Product and Business teams leverage our data assets to analyze and optimize user adoption, growth, and revenue.
   

  

 This role is based in our San Francisco office with an office\-centric hybrid schedule
 **.** 
 Along with most Asanas, you‚Äôll work from this office in person on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. If you're interviewing for this role, your Talent Acquisition Partner will share more about the in\-office requirements.
   

  

**What you‚Äôll achieve:**
* Design, implement and scale end\-to\-end data products that support growing data processing and analytical needs
* Transform raw data into actionable insights to drive product strategy, and power in\-depth analysis and reporting
* Partner with data scientists, domain experts, and engineering teams to develop a roadmap that aligns with our business goals
* Embrace broad ownership to expand your skills and influence the company‚Äôs data strategy
* Implement systems that guarantee data quality and availability


**About you:**
* 6\+ years of experience in Data Engineering or Software Engineering
* Experience in setting team's strategy and have a passion for mentoring other engineers
* Expertise in data modeling and building scalable data pipelines involving complex transformations
* Proficient in data processing and storage technologies like AWS/S3, Databricks, Spark, Python/Scala/Java, SQL, Airflow
* Proactive and innovative in identifying and addressing bottlenecks in existing workflows
* Demonstrates curiosity about AI tools and emerging technologies, with a willingness to learn and leverage them to enhance productivity, collaboration, or decision\-making


**What we‚Äôll offer:**
 Our comprehensive compensation package plays a big part in how we recognize you for the impact you have on our path to achieving our mission. We believe that compensation should be reflective of the value you create relative to the market value of your role. To ensure pay is fair and not impacted by biases, we're committed to looking at market value which is why we check ourselves and conduct a yearly pay equity audit.
   

  

 For this role, the estimated base salary range is between $248,000\-282,000\. The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed range above is a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified.
   

  

 In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity, sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.
   

  

 We strive to provide equitable and competitive benefits packages that support our employees worldwide and include:
   

  

* Mental health, wellness \& fitness benefits
* Career coaching \& support
* Inclusive family building benefits
* Long\-term savings or retirement plans
* In\-office culinary options to cater to your dietary preferences


 These are just some of the benefits we offer, and benefits may vary based on role, country, and local regulations. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.
   

  

**About Us**
 Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's \#1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor‚Äôs and Inc.‚Äôs Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in\-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office\-centric culture . With 11\+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.
   

  

 We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also comply with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws in other locations.

title: Clinical Data Specialist I (Remote)
description:
**Overview**
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
 The Clinical Data Specialist I needs a strong understanding of the products offered at Myriad and the clinical histories that are appropriate for each product. They will ensure that appropriate testing was performed as requested by the health care provider and contact providers to resolve any issues prior to testing. They will review all test results in conjunction with clinical histories and ensure the best possible patient care was given to each and every patient prior to sending out a report to the health care provider. Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and strong work ethic are essential to being successful.
   

  

***This is a technical position. You must have a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in a biological, chemical laboratory science or medical technology area in order to qualify.***
**Shift:** 
 Weekdays with the option of 5x8's or 4x10's
   

  

**Pay:** 
 $25/hr
   

  

**Responsibility**
 The Clinical Data Specialist I (CDS I) role is responsible for:
   

  

  

* Evaluating the clinical history of a patient in context to the test as it is first ordered and then performed together with the test results.
* Generating reports and querying in\-house data bases and on\-line resources to provide information about individual patient‚Äôs genetic test results and to answer questions about cumulative statistics pertaining to genetic test results.
* Performing clinical data entry and validation to ensure completeness and accuracy of data.
* Recognizing inconsistencies and initiating resolution of data problems.
* Assisting Research Coordinator in research collaborations with academic investigators for product development.


 Each employee‚Äôs specific job responsibilities are uniquely defined by their individual training plan and assigned duties, but are generally defined as follows:
   

  

**Reporting:**
* Check all reports in a timely, error\-free manner to maintain the goals of production.
* Generate manual and/or custom reports and uncertain variant forms.


**Client Support:**
* Respond to client inquiries in a timely, expert, and effective fashion.
* Initiate appropriate contacts with clients as necessary, pre\- and post\- test.


**Clinical Knowledge:**
* Pursue continuing education and expand knowledge and skills; attend training with Medical Information Liaison (MIL) team.


**Administrative:**
* Maintain databases in an appropriate manner.


**Organizational Interactions:**
* Maintain productive and collegial relationships with other MGL departments.
* Support and assist Laboratory Directors.
* Support and assist other Medical Services groups.


**Leadership:**
* Model values of Myriad.
* Identify unmet needs and/or process improvements.


**Qualifications**
* Meets minimum education and experience requirements:
+ Doctoral, master‚Äôs, or bachelor‚Äôs degree in medical technology or a chemical, biological, or clinical laboratory science.
+ Minimum 1 year of pertinent experience and/or training.

* Preferred: Excellent communication (written and oral) skills.
* Preferred: Proficiency in Windows, Word, and Excel.


**Physical Requirements**
 Lifting Requirements ‚Äì medium work or exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, 20 pounds of force frequently, and 10 pounds of force consistently. Physical Requirements ‚Äì stationary positioning, moving, operating, ascending/descending, communicating, observing, reaching, and repetitive motion. Use of equipment and tools necessary to perform essential job functions. Hazards and Atmospheric Conditions ‚Äì exposure to fumes, dust, extreme temperatures, wet and/or humid, noise, vibration, mists or gases, mechanical hazards, chemical hazards, electrical hazards, and radiant energy hazards. OSHA Category I ‚Äì duties performed routinely requires exposure to blood, body fluid, and tissue.
   

  

 EEO
   

  

 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. In hiring and all other employment decisions, we prohibit discrimination and harassment on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Support Specialist
description:
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Support Specialist to join our growing data and analytics team. In this role, you will ensure that stakeholders across the organization have access to accurate, timely, and actionable insights. You will support ad hoc reporting needs, monitor BI systems and data pipelines, and provide frontline support for BI tools. This is a great opportunity for someone with a strong foundation in BI tools and data warehouse solutions who enjoys solving problems, working with data, and helping others make data\-driven decisions.
   

  

**What You‚Äôll Do**
* Prepare and deliver ad hoc reports and analyses to support business needs
* Monitor data pipelines and BI systems to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve data or system issues
* Ensure data quality and consistency through validation and cleansing activities
* Maintain documentation of BI processes, data sources, and reporting standards
* Provide user support and training for BI tools, dashboards, and reports
* Manage report scheduling, distribution, and user access permissions

**What We‚Äôre Looking For**

* Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar)

* Experience with data validation, cleansing, and issue resolution
* Soft Skills o Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities
* Excellent communication skills to support both technical and non\-technical users
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities


**Why Join Us**
* Make a direct impact by helping teams across the organization make smarter, data driven decisions
* Be part of a collaborative, growth\-oriented environment where your ideas are valued
* Access to professional development opportunities to grow your BI and technical skills
* Competitive compensation and benefits package

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Inside the Role**
 The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for driving the data analytics and domain strategy at DTFS. This includes consulting with business areas on business information needs, translating business needs into analytics/BI requirements, developing the analytics/BI solution and interfacing with the business area to ensure successful customer outcomes. The Senior BI Analyst position is a Lead within the team and will include mentorship, training, and direction of other BI and contractors within the team. This position also serves as data steward and advanced technical support for supported business areas and is responsible for driving the future state of the digital strategy for the data domain. This position will also create/maintain technical design documentation to ensure capture of relevant meta data in support of the data management domain
   

  

**Posting Information**
 We provide a scheduled posting end date to assist our candidates with their application planning. While this date reflects our latest plans, it is subject to change, and postings may be extended or removed earlier than expected.
   

  

**We Take Care of Our Team**
**Pay Offered Dependent On Knowledge, Skills, And‚ÄØexperience**
 Benefits include annual bonus program; 401k‚ÄØcompany contribution with company match up to‚ÄØ6% as well as non\-elective company contribution of‚ÄØ3 \- 7% depending on age;‚ÄØstarting at 4 weeks paid‚ÄØvacation; 13\+ calendar holidays; 8 weeks paid‚ÄØparental leave; employee assistance program;‚ÄØcomprehensive healthcare plans and wellness‚ÄØprograms; onsite fitness (at some locations); tuition‚ÄØassistance and volunteer paid time off; short\-term‚ÄØand long\-term disability plans.
   

  

**What You Drive**
* The position will support the management reporting needs of business areas in both U.S. and Canada. Travel time is estimated at no more than 5%. In depth knowledge of the availability of data beyond the US in DWH, OPI/KPI metrics, and an understanding of the portability of US metrics to other markets is required.
* Data Insights Solution Development and Customer Support \- using various BI and Visualization tools, work with business areas to provide leadership on independent initiatives, facilitate information gathering, develop structured documentation, and present findings to all levels of management. Develop/maintain dashboards, analytics, and other data visualizations that provide business insight. This includes gathering and analyzing requirements from business users and developing BI solutions. This includes advanced support for SQL/reports/End User Computing (EUC) applications for internal customers. Collaborate with IT partners and business partners in support of month end processes where applicable.
* Data Mart and Cognos Framework Design \- This role may include the Data Mart design and Cognos Framework Management. If so, this position will manage the framework for the reporting environment. Architect and model existing data to be easily consumed by customers and reports. Optimize performance of BI solutions through working with ETL and DBA resources.
* Data stewardship ‚Äì Partner with the business, IT, and the DIAA to drive the BI environment to meet future business needs. Work with business SMEs to identify and close existing data gaps in the BI environment. Develops and writes business information requirements for the changes to the BI landscape. Analyze and assess impacts to the data warehouse and BI landscape for key project initiatives. Collaborate with IT partners to translate business requirements into technical specifications for IT supported system solutions.
* Project management \- Lead EPM and Data Domain owned projects. Drive data management domain initiatives and projects to assess impact to BI domain. Meet project schedules, identify potential issues and develop workarounds as needed to ensure continuity of BI solutions.
* Data Preparation/Ad Hoc BI Support \- Develop and maintain curated data sets needed to support the Advanced Analytics group use cases. Provide advanced technical support to the business analysts as needed using various BI tools including usage review and performance tuning. Support the business as necessary to clear audit/compliance conditions.
* Strategy/BI Governance: Contribute to the short\- and long\-term strategic approach for the Data Domain. As new technology and tools are identified, support the development of strategy for associated BI products, models, visualizations, governance, etc.


**Knowledge You Should Bring**
* BS/BA and prefer 5\-7 years of relevant experience or 8 years of experience in Data, Analytics, and Reporting in lieu of degree.
* 3 years of experience working in Data, Analytics, and reporting.
* 3 years of experience working with SQL(specifically building reports and preparing data).
* Knowledge in Data Visualization, Reporting.
* Experience working with Structured Data stored in a RDBMS.


**Exceptional Candidates Might Have**
* Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, Computer/Information Science, Economics, Finance, Information Technology, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or related field.
* Experience with Python, SAS Programming, Alteryx, AI, Cognos Analytics, Cognos Framework, Cognos Transformer, Tableau, MS Power BI, Data Management and Governance, Finance (automotive industry).


 \#DTFSUSA and

 Hybrid (4 days per week in\-office / 1 day remote). This schedule builds our \#OneTeamBestTeam culture, provides an unparalleled customer experience, and creates innovative solutions through in\-person collaboration.

title: Data Analyst-24
description:
**Job Description**
**Data Analyst**
*As required by our governmental client, this position requires an active SECRETclearance to be considered* 
 .
   

  

*A government contract requires that this position be restricted to U.S. citizens or legal permanent residents. You must provide documentation that you are a U.S. citizen or legal permanent resident to qualify.*
 As a Data Specialist, the individual contributes by analyzing data relevant to the division's operations.
   

  

**Compensation \& Benefits**
* Estimated Starting Salary Range for Data Analyst: Pay commensurate with experience.
* Full time benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and other possible benefits as provided. Benefits are subject to change with or without notice.


**Data Analyst Responsibilities Include**
* Utilize internal databases to build, run, and export queries with data related to particularly data related to ONR Regional Offices. This includes using lookup and pivot table functions for data exported to MS Excel in order to combine and analyze the data.
* Review data to identify anomalies (e.g., potential system issues) and potential weaknesses in business processes or internal controls.
* Generate metrics; displaying data in PowerPoint presentations.
* Performing day\-to\-day data collection and computer processing of standard and specialized report generation, data management, graphics/presentation production, and administrative support.
* Update performer information in DoD‚Äôs EDA system when request received from performers of ONR awards or from awarding officers.
* Take notes and providing other administrative support at (e.g., onsite or other training venues) and for wide meetings and disseminating notes as directed.
* Collect, analyze, and report analysis of the self\-assessments, which includes the monthly file reviews of the Regional Offices. This process includes discussing apparent data issues, conflicts, and omissions with reporting offices to ensure offices‚Äô correct data.
* Format, compile, and enter data related to rate agreements to be uploaded into appropriate databases and/or websites.
* Create, and sometimes maintain, trackers for certain types of workloads (e.g., rate agreements, disclosure statements).
* Provide support to facilitate identifying, collecting, and preparing paper and electronic files to be archived.
* Scan documentation for electronic files when requested.
* Track and prepare delinquent proposal letters.
* Assist in determining whether non\-profits entities with which ONR has rate agreements are still in business or performing business for the government.
* Assist regional office personnel in getting final technical reports approved for ONR awards after those personnel have spent reasonable efforts attempting to get the approval themselves.
* Prepare mass emails to non\-profit and university communities.
* Support interim (generally monthly) and annual billing of any ONR reimbursable work performed under any Memorandum of Agreement (MOA).
* Performs other job\-related duties as assigned


**Data Analyst Experience, Education, Skills, Abilities Requested**
* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university.
* Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a subject that places an emphasis on statistical and analytic skills (e.g., statistics, finance, economics) is desired.
* Knowledge of statistical tests and tools and the functions of mean, median, variance, standard deviation, correlation, regression, and hypothesis testing to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends Knowledge and experience to perform tasks listed in Requirement Tasks of the Performance Work Statement.
* Must pass pre\-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal


**Company Information**
**Cherokee Strategic Solutions (CSS)** 
 is a part of Cherokee Federal ‚Äì the division of tribally owned federal contracting companies owned by Cherokee Nation Businesses. As a trusted partner for more than 60 federal clients, Cherokee Federal LLCs are focused on building a brighter future, solving complex challenges, and
 **serving** 
 the government‚Äôs mission with compassion and heart. To learn more about
 **CSS** 
 , visit cherokee\-federal.com.
   

  

**\#CherokeeFederal**
 Cherokee Federal is a military friendly employer. Veterans and active military transitioning to civilian status are encouraged to apply.

* Business Intelligence Analyst
* Operations Data Analyst
* Performance Metrics Analyst
* Financial Data Analyst


**Keywords**
* Data Analysis
* Statistical Techniques
* Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Lookups)
* Business Intelligence Tools
* Metrics Reporting

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected veteran status, disability or any other status protected under applicable federal, state or local law. Many of our job openings require access to government buildings or military installations. Candidates must pass pre\-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal.

title: Project Data Analyst
description:
Sunoco LP is a leading energy infrastructure and fuel distribution master limited partnership operating across 47 U.S. states, Puerto Rico, Europe, and Mexico. The Partnership's midstream operations include an extensive network of approximately 9,500 miles of pipeline and over 100 terminals. This critical infrastructure complements the Partnership's fuel distribution operations, which serve approximately 10,000 convenience stores, independent dealers, commercial customers, and distributors.
   

  

 At Sunoco, we take great pride in what we do and wholeheartedly believe our employees drive success for our company and our customers. We are always looking for the best and brightest talent and we are committed to making your job a challenging and rewarding experience.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 Responsible for creating material and service requisitions, generating cost control reports and provides general support to Project Managers/Specialist for capital projects both domestic and international. Trains and supervises company and contract personnel in the use of SAP to create requisitions, receive goods and services for purchase orders, generate cost control reports for use by Project Engineers and make recommendations to Project Managers regarding cost control measures and process improvements.
   

  

**Major Accountabilities**
* Create requisitions in SAP for the purchase of materials and services
* Communicate with Procurement to ensure requisitions are done properly
* Receive goods and services for purchase orders in SAP
* Handle time \& material invoices for project managers.Serve as the main contact for outside vendors to handle questions about invoices and payment
* Work with project managers and Contract Administration to set up new vendors in SAP
* Work with the SAP group to resolve problems associated with requisitions and invoices
* Assist project managers by working with Accounts Payable to resolve invoice problems
* Serve as main contact for Internal Audit to resolve invoice issues
* Run SAP reports and generate cost control metrics for use by project managers
* Work with project managers to gather monthly project spending forecasts
* Prepare monthly budget forecast for Capital strategic plan
* Provide general support to Project Managers
* Possess excellent oral and written communication skills
* Be proficient with SAP and Microsoft software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
* Be able to work in a team environment as well as independently


**Education Requirements**
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree from an accredited university required.
   

  

**Experience Requirement**
* 2 \- 5 years related experience required.
* A working knowledge of SAP preferred.
* A working knowledge of how tax, internal audit, capital assets accounting, and procurement affect capital projects preferred.
* Experience working with engineering and technical personnel.
* Possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Be proficient with Microsoft software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
* Be able to work in a team environment as well as independently

title: Staff Technical Data Analyst
description:
**Overview**
 Are you passionate about empowering people to test the impact of their ideas? Are you motivated by data\-driven decisions? If 'yes', then the Intuit Experimentation Team (IXP) could be the right team for you.
   

  

 The experimentation team builds and maintains the Intuit experimentation Platform, an enterprise\-wide capability for moving rapidly and reliably from hypothesis to action. At Intuit, all teams (TurboTax, Mailchimp and QuickBooks to name a few) use IXP. Our aim is to give every individual at Intuit a voice by providing them a platform where they can test their ideas and have data from their experiments backing their ideas.
   

  

 We have:
   

  

* An opportunity for you to influence the experimentation program at Intuit
* An opportunity for you to enable innovation across Intuit with your contributions tothe experimentation platform
* An opportunity to work with the latest technology and frameworks.
* An opportunity to work with a collaborative, customer\-obsessed, and diverseengineering team


 What you'll bring
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or arelated quantitative field, or equivalent work experience.
* 6\+ years of combined post\-graduate academic and industry experience applyingquantitative and scientific methods to solve real\-world business problems.
* Advanced experience in statistical analysis, test design, and experimentation.
* Proven ability to analyze large, complex datasets.
* Proficiency in SQL, data visualization tools (Qlik, Tableau, QuickSight, Looker), and scripting languages (Python, R).
* Strong data storytelling skills, with the ability to construct impactful visualizations, communicate insights, and influence leadership.
* A proactive and results\-oriented individual who thrives in a fast\-paced environment and is comfortable with ambiguity.


 How you will lead
   

  

* Design and develop reliable, scalable, and maintainable services and tools.
* Write clean and performant code.
* Mentor engineers on the team to produce high quality code with code reviews and learning sessions.
* Collaborate with your teammates, designers, and stakeholders to deliver features and solutions that add business value and delight our customers.

title: Intelligence Analyst
description:
Take2 Consulting is seeking an Intelligence Analyst to support our client onsite in Alexandria, VA. This role requires strong research, monitoring, and briefing skills to support FPS operations and intelligence reporting. The Analyst will provide open\-source threat monitoring, intelligence analysis, and support critical incident management.
 



**RESPONSIBILITIES** 




  




* Participate in the Open\-Source Threat Intelligence Program.
* Monitor open sources to identify potential threats to federal facilities.
* Support regional special event open\-source information needs.
* Coordinate conveyance of threat information to leadership.
* Liaise with the Intelligence Division on research and intelligence production.
* Conduct research and manage data for intelligence activities.
* Identify trends in threats and criminal activities and analyze for operational impacts.
* Generate data, briefings, reports, and intelligence products as required.
* Communicate intelligence assessments and forecasts during turnover briefs.
* Prepare the Daily Intelligence Review Bulletin.
* Support field requests for information and law enforcement system checks.
* Maintain access to intelligence systems.
* Gather requested information, package appropriately, and convey to stakeholders.
* Contribute to JIMC Critical Incident Management by gathering and correlating intelligence data.
* Ensure compliance with classification and sensitive information handling requirements.
* Support Watch operations as needed.
* Ensure accuracy of deliverables and commitment to quality and customer support.


- 


**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS** 



* Bachelor‚Äôs degree required.
* Ability to obtain a Top Secret Clearance and DHS Suitability.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with MS Office (PowerPoint, SharePoint, Excel).
* Experience preparing briefing materials and intelligence products.
* Strong independent work ethic and proven self\-starter.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Outstanding customer service skills and acute attention to detail.
* Ability to work onsite in Alexandria, VA and travel within the DC Metro region.

title: Analyst, Data Governance
description:
UTA seeks a detail\-oriented Analyst, Data Governance to join our Data Management Office (DMO). In this critical role, you‚Äôll be the guardian of one of our agency‚Äôs most valuable assets‚Äîits data. You‚Äôll ensure the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of our core information, providing a single source of truth that empowers every department across the agency. Success in this role requires not only a passion for data integrity and a keen eye for detail, but also strong communication skills and a business\-minded approach, partnering with teams across the agency to translate fast\-moving requests into accurate, actionable information. This is an excellent opportunity to make a meaningful impact at the intersection of data and business operations.lent opportunity to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

 The salary range for this role $60,000 to $70,000 commensurate with experience and skills
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Collaborate with Technology \& Business teams across UTA to integrate governance requirements into product and operational workflows
* Maintain and update authoritative data for clients, talent, buyers, and other critical entities, ensuring a single source of truth across all agency systems. Monitor data request submissions, manage status reporting, and escalate critical delivery issues
* Serve as a primary point of contact for data\-related inquiries and issues from various departments. Drive investigation and hands\-on remediation of high\-impact data incidents. Research problems, provide solutions, and communicate findings clearly
* Proactively identify, investigate and resolve data discrepancies, errors, and inconsistencies within and across applications. Implement and execute data cleansing and enrichment processes to ensure data is accurate, complete, and reliable
* Ensure strict adherence to established data governance policies, standards, and procedures of data entry, storage, usage and security. Monitor compliance with internal guidelines and external regulations. Support internal and external audits, risk assessments, and remediation efforts
* Support the measurement of SLAs and KPIs for data accuracy, completeness, consistency, and timeliness. Proactively identify opportunities for improvement and track progress against identified improvement opportunities
* Assist in developing and delivering training materials and guidance to agency staff on data entry best practices, data governance principles, and proper system usage to foster a data\-conscious culture
* Develop and maintain comprehensive metadata including data definitions and business rules to help ensure that data is well\-understood and consistently used across the organization


**What You Will Need**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Information Systems, Data Management, or related field, or equivalent experience
* 2\+ years of experience in data management, governance, operations, or business support roles where accuracy, organization, and stakeholder interaction were central
* Experience within an entertainment, media, or professional services environment is preferred
* Strong understanding of Authoritative Data Management principles and best practices
* Experience with data quality tools and techniques
* Exceptional attention to detail and a methodical approach to problem\-solving
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify patterns, troubleshoot data issues, and propose effective solutions
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non\-technical stakeholders
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team\-oriented environment
* Desired, but not required: familiarity with talent agency data and operations within the entertainment industry


**What You Will Get**
* The unique and exciting opportunity to work at one of the leading global entertainment companies
* Access to the tools, leadership, and resources you will need to create and drive a center of excellence
* The opportunity to do the best work of your career
* Work in an inclusive and diverse company culture
* Competitive benefits and programs to support your well\-being
* Experience working in a collaborative environment with room to grow


**About UTA**
 UTA unites ideas, opportunities and talent. The company represents some of the world's most iconic, barrier\-breaking artists, creators and changemakers‚Äîfrom actors, athletes and musicians to writers, gamers and digital influencers. One of the most influential companies in global entertainment, UTA's business spans talent representation, content production, as well as strategic advisory and marketing work with some of the world's biggest brands. Affiliated companies include Digital Brand Architects, KLUTCH Sports Group, Curtis Brown Group, and MediaLink. UTA is headquartered in Los Angeles with offices in Atlanta, Chicago, Nashville, New York and London.
   

  

 For more information: https://www.unitedtalent.com/about/
   

  

 UTA and its Affiliated Companies are Equal Employment Opportunity employers and welcome all job seekers including individuals with disabilities and veterans with disabilities.
